p: Chlorpromazine anti-JEV activity by using the vertebrate cell line Vero was analyzed by Nawa et al. (2003). The drug caused inhibition of the Japanese encephalitis virus and the number of JEV antigen-positive cells was about 80% lower in comparison to the untreated culture. The percentage of JEV antigen-positive cells was 60% (control samples) and 11% in chlorpromazine (10 μg/ml) treated cultures.
